data.author: reductor
data.name: Coroutine

data.description:
We're pretty sure there's been a hack into our system. The incident is suspected to be caused by an employee opening a document file received via email even though he deleted it shortly afterwards. We managed to do a logical acquisition of data from his hard drive. However, when we open the document file, it looks empty, can you analyze what it contains?

[Attachment](https://mega.nz/folder/y1EhgIYD#VYAjIOT53HRtRgD4416Oag)

`nc typop.chal.idek.team 1337`

**NOTE:** There's a $70 write-up prize courtesy of the author.
data.author: JW#9396
data.name: Typop

data.description:
Someone has died unexpectedly. 
The police is on it, but between you and me, I cannot wait for the police. 
I am a private investigator and I need your help. 
Unfortunately, we might be tracked so I cannot give you the information directly. 
Start in a major social network. 
Certainly not a problem for the best hacker I know right...?
Alright here goes a beautiful poem: 

```
Some people in weird ways were connected
Some were a triangle, some were less directed
For one night they all met
At doctor's Jonathan Abigdail the third they wept 
Things were said, threats in the air
A few days later someone is dead
Who is that someone? That is for you to find,
Also who is the killer, if you really don't mind.
```

**Note for the all the challenges:**
The challenge is divided into three challenges: Where, Weapon, and Who.  Where is the first one the others will come later.
In each one you can find the flag somwhere online. 
You might find the information in any order, however the expected order is: Where, Weapon and Who. 
Example: If the answer is knife then when you would discover that somewhere: like 
"the killer used a `idek{knife_V5478G}`" or instructions on how to get the flag: like `idek{weaponUsed_V5478G}`. The flag would then be `idek{knife_V5478G}`.

data.description:
We tried to collect more network data for analysis, but because of the late approach, we only had data for a short period of time before we detected the attack and performed a shutdown of all machine at about 19:00 UTC. However I hope it can help you to answer the question whether the attacker has access to our important data?

[Attachment](https://mega.nz/folder/y1EhgIYD#VYAjIOT53HRtRgD4416Oag)

data.name: task manager

data.description:
You did it! You found the killer!!! But whyy oh why did she do it?

Apparently she was obsessed with stamps, but was it real or not?

Well, I found this image on her computer, maybe it can help you.

Also a nice poem:

```
A man of peace, a collector too  
His name, Johan J√∏rgen, forever true  
A network vast, across the land  
His passion, stamps, with Olympic brand  
  
A stamp of Seoul, in '88  
Issued to commemorate, the games we all love  
A rare find, this stamp of Olympic dream  
But where, oh where, can it be seen?  

A man of peace, his legacy lives on  
In stamps and memories, forever strong  
But where to find, this elusive prize  
A mystery yet, to the collector's eyes.  
```

`The flag is idek{STAMP_IDENTIFIER}, ex: idek{OLX-42069}`

*Note: This challenge does not need any information from the previous challenges*
